Articles.Content:
I used Hyper-Edit to put a lander in Laythe orbit to test. Could not locate a land area from orbit to target. So how and what do I change to lessen the effects of Scatterer? I like what it does, it is just does it too well. Same problem but not quite as intense in Kerbin orbit.

In addition to Scatterer, I use E.V.E. 7-4 with Edge of Oblivion, Distant Object Enhancement, and Planet Shine. In case there is a conflict elsewhere, I am also use OPM, Arkas, Asclepius, and Kronkus. At least one of those are not updated to the version of Kopernicus I have loaded but I don't think the issue is with planet packs.

Well,this is not Scatterer's fault(scatterer is working only for Kerbin),it's Edge of Oblivion that make these dense clouds on Eve.Then there are many things you can do to fix your problem.

When in map view you can press Alt+n to get the E.V.E Gui and from there you can,either delete,edit cloud layers or reset to default,which will make Eve's clouds all purple and better see through.

Also,when you are in map view,double click on Eve and zoom close to planet,that way you be able to see the ground or at least the icon of your lender.
Why the hell did you ask this here and not the scatterer thread?

12 hours ago, mythbusters844 said:

Why the hell did you ask this here and not the scatterer thread?

1. Forum title: Technical Support (modded installs)

2. I have several visual mods and knew one of the others could be the culprit, although in my own defense, I thought I had been to Laythe after adding EoO without issue. Turns out I was wrong.

3. In the Scatterer forum I believe my post would have simply been lost in foamy waves of ocean texture posts.

4. Sorry I offended. 

Where do you suggest I post to get help tweaking Edge of Oblivion? I don't have a clue what to change once I press Alt-N.

3 hours ago, Red Shirt said:

I don't have a clue what to change once I press Alt-N.

 

You know KSP is a learning curve.

Try to read some older posts in E.V.E forum thread(read manual instructions first  ),or you can just try to edit/delete whatever you want.Some times,from pressing different buttons without any knowledge,can teach you more than reading the manual(like buying new stereo).It depends on each individual.

Only worry,you have to backup the *.cfg so you can start over if something goes wrong.

Edited December 24, 2015 by sebi.zzr
